p: Pelargonium sidoides ( P. sidoides) belongs to the family of Geraniaceae and is commonly known as Umckaloabo [ 191]. It is found all over the world and roots of this plant are traditionally used for remedial purposes against tuberculosis, respiratory diseases, cough, gastrointestinal infection, viral diseases and others [ 191, 193]. P. sidoides roots are known to have some potent compounds, such as methoxycoumarin, proanthocyanidins and prodelphinidins [ 192]. Furthermore, its roots are also used for the production of herbal drugs known as EPs 7639 by ethanolic extract, which have been approved for the treatment of respiratory tract infections [ 191, 194]. According to Theisen et al., 2012, P. sidoides also has the potential to inhibit the viral entry of the influenza virus [ 194]. Therefore, it is suggested that roots of P. sidoides should be further investigated for the treatment of COVID-19.
